notesStmt.note: Yeḳuti᾿el ben Shelomoh: inscribed with his name in the colophon, 28 Sivan [5]134 [1374] (folio 298v ); Yeḳuti᾿el is marked off in the initial letters of the lines (folio 84v). Menaḥem ben Natan, first owner: inscribed with his name in the colophon, 28 Sivan [5]134 [1374] (folio 298v). Hananel Menaḥem ben Yehi᾿el sold to Mosheh ben Yosef: inscribed with their name in a purchase note, 2 December, [5]192 [1432] (folio 2r, upside down). Shelomoh ben Shim῾on: inscribed with his name as witness in a purchase note, 2 December, [5]192 [1432] (folio 2r). Yom Tov ben Yitsḥaḳ: inscribed with his name as witness in a purchase note, 2 December, [5]192 [1432] (folio 2r). David of Venturaowner: a list of manuscripts and printed books owned by him, 1501 (folios 1r, 2r). Yehudah Zeraḥyah ῾Azulai: inscribed with his name, 16th century (folios 1r, 20r). Yosef Yehudah ben Yehudah Zeraḥyah ῾Azulai: inscribed with his name, 16th century (folio 1r). Shemu᾿el ben Yitsḥaḳ Azari᾿el of Lavolta: inscribed with his name as a missing person, August 1535 (folio 2v ). Menaḥem of Lavolta, Shemu'el’s brother: inscribed with his name, August 1535 (folio 2v). Mosheh of Lavolta ben Yitsḥaḳ: sold to Yosef ben Shelomoh Fo᾿ah: purchase note, 17 November, 1542 (folio 3r). Latin inscription, 1556 (folio 3r). Laurentius Franguellus: inscribed with his name, 1575 (folio 2r ). Luigi da Bologna: inscribed with his name, 1600 (folio 298v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Halakhic decisions of Isaiah of Trani, the younger, aka Pisḳe R. Yeshayah Aḥaron.
